content:
Diagnosis:	Gastric adenocarcinoma

Management:	Total gastrectomy March 2024

Histology:	pT4aN2M0 tubular adenocarcinoma, HER2 negative, MSI stable

Current Situation:	Post-operative follow-up

I reviewed [redacted name] in clinic today following completion of adjuvant CAPOX chemotherapy. He has recovered well from his treatment with resolution of the grade 1 peripheral neuropathy that developed during cycle 4. His appetite remains stable with appropriate nutritional supplementation, and weight has stabilized at 72kg. Performance status is 1.

On examination today, surgical wounds are well healed with no concerning features. Blood tests show stable parameters with improvement in previous mild anaemia.

We have arranged CT chest/abdomen/pelvis for 3 months' time as per surveillance protocol. He will be reviewed in clinic following these scans. I have provided written information about post-gastrectomy care and symptoms that should prompt earlier review.
